conclusion: Analyze the graph of velocity squared versus displacement for two cars with uniform acceleration.
The graph shows two lines, A and B, with the x-axis representing displacement and the y-axis representing velocity squared.
Identify the slope of each line on the graph as the change in y-axis value divided by the change in x-axis value.
For Car A, the slope is the square of its velocity over displacement.
For Car B, the slope is the square of its velocity over displacement.
Since both cars start from the same position and move in the same direction, the slope of their lines will be equal.
Therefore, the square of the velocity over displacement for both cars will be the same.
Since the slope of the line for Car A is greater than that for Car B, the velocity squared for Car A is greater than that for Car B.
Therefore, the acceleration of Car A is greater than that of Car B.
Conclude that Car A has the greater acceleration based on the slope of the line representing velocity squared versus displacement.
